alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. A cluster of nearly stationary thunderstorms is expected to remain between Shadowmoss to the Interstate 526 corridor of Mount Pleasant through most of the remainder of this afternoon. So far, radar estimated rainfall indicates that between 1.5 to 3 inches of rainfall has fallen across the area. The ongoing runoff combined with additional heavy rainfall will likely lead to hazardous travel conditions on area roadways. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Charleston Naval Complex, Riverfront Park, Cooper River Marina, Park Circle, James Edward Bridge, Hobcaw Point, Westmoreland Bridge, Wando Terminal, Snowden and Shadowmoss.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
